dialogues.QUAIL:
[1]I dreamed about Mars again... it was bizarre, yet is was so real... 
[2]People do go to Mars, you know. 
[3]You know -- let's really do it. 
[4]No.  Go to Mars. 
[5]We can pool our savings and I've got some sick leave coming, besides my regular vacation... 
[6]That's just media talk.  They're... ...just a minority.  They're powerless. 
[7]I'll be late! 
[8]I keep forgetting, Herb.  They frighten me. 
[9]Okay.  Herb, okay. 
[10]But... is the process really that effective?  A false memory!? We prefer the term "extra- factual implant".  Your memory will be complete in every way.  You will have gone to Mars.  We guarantee that. 
[11]Is it in any way dangerous? I mean, the medical techniques? Not when you deal with qualified operators - like us. 
[12]It's just - incredible. And look at our follow-up program! Space-flight ticket stub... passport... vaccination certificates... matchbooks from Martian Nouvelle Cuisine Restaurants, souvenirs, post cards... even names of people you met - now back there - who you can call and discuss your trip with... by the way, we plant these things where you'll come across them at random in the future. 
[13]But... I'll know I hired you. That'll destroy the whole illusion. But you won't remember me, or having been here. 
[14]I won't? Your money back if you do! We've never paid out yet. And we have a special this month, for only two-hundred thousand dollars more. 
[15]"Intelligence Agent"... wouldn't that be dangerous?  I might attack.... No.  No.  You're a retired agent.  Mars was your last mission and you're never to break your cover.  But you'll have got the girl, killed the baddies, and saved the Universe.  Not bad, eh? 
[16]I don't know... about the whole thing... it's all such a fake.  I won't really have gone.  I won't really.... Let's face it, Douglas, you, and millions of people like you have no chance of ever getting to Mars and you'd never qualify as a secret agent for EIO.  This - REKALL - is the only way to achieve your dream. Think about it, Douglas. Think, too, what a terrible boor a real holiday is. Lost tickets, endless arguments, lousy hotels, missed connections, rotten weather... Rekall will supply you with perfect, happy memories. 
[17]You know that's illegal. 
[18]instrument console 
[19]Well... I'd like to see the Martian Sphinx... 
[20]One hundred... ninety-nine... ninety-eight... ninety-seven... ninety-six... ninety-five.... 
[21]...Sophie.... 
[22]...Yes.... 
[23]Yes. 
[24]All of you in this room are dead. What's he talking about? 
[25]You've broken my cover. What is this?... 
[26]You've compromised the Sphinx Project.  You'll have to be silenced. Wait a minute.  Quail -- 
[27]My name isn't Quail. Listen... whoever you are... sir.... ...This is all an accident. We'll destroy all the records. No one will know.  I swear it. Believe me. 
[28]I believe you, but that won't stop E.T.O. from killing you. 
[29]Killing you... killing you... killing you.... 
[30]Where am I? 
[31]Where am I going? 
[32]How did I get here? 
[33]How did I get into this cab? 
[34]Mr. Zimmer...Mr. Zimmer... help me... they're... 
[35]Where are you taking me? 
[36]But I didn't... Are you telling me... I did go to Mars?  I don't remember? 
[37]remembers only fragments 
[38]What do you mean? 
[39]What are you going to do with me? 
[40]My God!  No!  You're going to kill me! 
[41]No!  It's not my fault!  You can't do it! 
[42]Wait a minute, I remember -- 
[43]On Mars... they tried to kill me... And.... 
[44]Did you know I've been to Mars? 
[45]I think I've been.  I vaguely recall... 
[46]Forget?  Remembering is the problem I must've been to one of those artificial memory places... 
[47]But something went wrong... something about a real memory... and then those men...  tried to kill me. 
[48]No.  That's what's so amazing. I killed them.  I think... 
[49]I'm involved somehow with E.I.O.  It's true.  It's no fantasy. 
[50]For fuck's sake, this is no breakdown! 
[51]My God!  Did you say I need a psychiatrist? 
[52]How could you do it?  After eight years! 
[53]Not my wife!  You are out of your mind. 
[54]Why are you lying like this? 
[55]But why all of this? 
[56]But I remember it!  All of it!... Us! 
[57]Our friends... my work... eight years. 
[58]This is crazy!  If all my memories are false, who am I?  What am I?  Jesus... it's like I don't exist. 
[59]Why did you try to kill me? Why does E.I.O. want me dead? 
[60]Well, what did I do on Mars that they have to keep me from telling? 
[61]All right... I'm leaving. Don't try and follow me -- 
[62]No wonder you got the role as my bitchy wife -- type casting. 
[63]A room for the night. 
[64]Here's ten thousand.  Forget the ID. 
[65]I have a liaison with a lady... and I'm married... 
[66]I told you, I don't want to be disturbed. 
[67]Who are you?  What the hell is this? 
[68]Why should I trust you? 
[69]Keep talking. 
[70]What do I want with Grecian candlesticks! 
[71]How did you know where to find me? 
[72]You're E.I.O.  You're on the other team. 
[73]I can't remember - only bits... 
[74]I'm Hotchkiss...I came for the...Grecian candlesticks... 
[75]I wonder if you could tell me... 
[76]Martian money.... 
[77]What the hell...? 
[78]It's no Garden of Eden. 
[79]What do you know about that? 
[80]Yeah.  Got destroyed in the Arab wars... What about this independence movement? 
[81]Sure.  Douglas Quail. 
[82]Prejudiced?  Against what? 
[83]What are they singing? 
[84]Nice to be back. I'm flattered you remember me. 
[85]Do you remember my first name, too? 
[86]I'm impressed. Listen.  I need transportation to the... uh... the Sphinx. Can you arrange it for me? 
[87]What item?  Oh... yes, please. 
[88]That one's closer. 
[89]Right. 
[90]What is this, Bennie... Tombstone? 
[91]I'm looking for Melina Noel. 
[92]Well, uh... I... 
[93]What note? 
[94]I don't have a wife.  Well, I do - but not a real wife. Hell... look... someone else sent that note.  Someone who -- 
[95]For you!  I don't even know why -- 
[96]Whoever I was, I must have been a helluva guy. 
[97]Listen.  I've for to tell  you something.  I beg you to believe me... help me -- 
[98]Something happened to my mind. Memory suppression, false implant, I don't know what -- 
[99]What I'm saying is... I don't remember you.  I don't remember us.  I don't remember me -- 
[100]Who is us? 
[101]Wait... I was an agent -- I'm not now -- just tell me who I am!  How did we know each other?  Why are they trying to kill me?! 
[102]You loved me once, you must have -- 
[103]Please, Melina -- 
[104]I need your help -- 
[105]Yeah, right. 
[106]Listen, Bennie.  You're pretty well informed? 
[107]What do you know about the Sphinx? 
[108]I have to get there.  Can't you help me? 
[109]What? 
[110]Cohaagen?  But isn't he often here? 
[111]Who is it? 
[112]Who are you? 
[113]Rekall?? 
[114]All right... come in. 
[115]Okay -- so you're Doctor George Edgemar of 'Rekall, Inc.'  So? 
[116]I'm listening. 
[117]Sat that again. 
[118]Are you trying to tell me that this is all part of some... artificially injected fantasy? That I never really left Earth? 
[119]What is this shit you're giving me? 
[120]Then how the hell can you be in my dream -- if you know it's just a dream? 
[121]I don't believe a word you're saying. 
[122]So what's supposed to happen now? 
[123]Somehow that doesn't appeal to me. 
[124]If this is a fantasy, there'll be no real consequences when I pull this trigger. 
[125]What happens it I come out? 
[126]All right.  Here comes the weapon. 
[127]Back in, quick! 
[128]In! 
[129]Okay.  Answers!  Now! 
[130]I don't know why they're after me, but what's your connection with all this? 
[131]Believe me, I'm really sorry I can't recall the details of that encounter. 
[132]Lose them?  In this? 
[133]
[134]What's all this? 
[135]So you two are into something a bit more serious than the taxi and truck-stop business. 
[136]My God!... T-shirts.  They died out on Earth years ago. 
[137]So where did I fit into all this? 
[138]Yeah.  And I can't even remember it.  We'll have to arrange a return bout. 
[139]But - the Sphinx.  Why is that stuck in my mind?  Why's it so important? 
[140]It's more than that, Bennie, I know it's more.  Somehow it's connected. 
[141]How?  What?  Where?  When? 
[142]What?  Why? 
[143]Wow.  I can see why I was willing to betray E.I.O. 
[144]Yes.  Of course.  That, too. 
[145]What use is this weirdo? 
[146]And you're going to help me by reading my mind? 
[147]A fee! 
[148]Five-hundred-thousand Martian dollars, that's... 
[149]With today's exchange rate... that's over two million Martian dollars! 
[150]Okay!  Okay!  I'll pay it, but the Interstellar Trade Practices Commission might be interested in this. 
[151]Why did you kill him?  It was the next bit I really... 
[152]Stands.  For a moment his back is to Melina and Bennie. Then he turns. He has become a different man.  His eyes gleam.  He is forceful, purposeful, contained.  Once again the ace E.I.O. agent.  Melina senses immediately that this is the man she knew before 
[153]I'm fine... only I'm not Doug -- I'm Charles Hauser... and I know everything Hauser knew. 
[154]Bennie, where's your depot? 
[155]Can you get us there? 
[156]We're going to the Sphinx. 
[157]Only everything.  I've got total recall. 
[158]The Sphinx... it's not some useless artifact, it's a machine built by some alien race eighteen millions years ago.  The same race that built the on one Earth... for the same purpose. 
[159]This is what we need. 
[160]Come on, Bennie, move it. Have you heard the word, "terriform"? 
[161]The machine in the Sphinx is tapped straight down to the molten core of this planet. There are tunnels and ducts everywhere, all powered by fusion generators... 
[162]To combine elements in the Martian core and release them as oxygen, hydrogen and nitrogen. 
[163]That's right.  Air and water. Terriforming will create a permanent livable environment for Mars.  No more pressurized cities, no more containers in the desert.  There'll be rivers, vegetation - life - the same as Earth. 
[164]Don't you see?!  From being a pile of red dirt with minerals, Mars is going to change into  a chunk of priceless real estate. 
[165]Right!  He can start selling it off to well-heeled investors from Earth.  Beach condos, ski resorts, you name it. 
[166]Once word of this gets out, the whole planet will support you. 
[167]Ruin his little scheme by terriforming ahead of schedule - while the inhabitants are still here. 
[168]I'm the only one who does. Why do you think Cohaagen's left me alone all this time? 
[169]I was the first one inside when they cracked the riddle of the Sphinx.  It must've been programmed.  Some kind of...force...shot into me. 
[170]Just a way of putting me on ice.  He'd of reversed it once the planet was evacuated. 
[171]What he hadn't counted on was your effect on me. 
[172]Bennie, don't stop now, take it... 
[173]I should have known, you were just too helpful. 
[174]Hope I've got this direction right. 
[175]A shame.  Such a pleasant trip. 
[176]This is the main tap -- straight down to the core of Mars.  When we trigger the mechanism, fusion reactors will detonate down there -- four hundred miles deep. 
[177]The new elements will come booming up through this shaft -- and six thousand others all around the planet. 
[178]Mail-order company.  It's a great one for fooling the wife. 
[179]Know how to use one of these? 
[180]Catch! 
[181]If you're afraid of the heights, you better get over it real quick. 
[182]Yes... 
[183]Yes... there's a vital connection missing... 
[184]...me... 
[185]Wrong, Cohaagen, there's a long tunnel, a brilliant white light, hands reaching for me... 
[186]You don't deserve a new world, you and people like you made too big a mess of the old one. Time someone else had a chance. 
[187]Am I dying? 
[188]That's just the start.  Next there'll be rain and growth and ... life. 
[189]Rekall could never have come up with anything like this.
dialogues.MELINA:
[1]You bastard! 
[2]You bastard... 
[3]That's new -- the innocent look. You didn't have that one before. Well? 
[4]All right, I'll say it for you. 
[5]Don't worry.  I got the note. You discharged your obligation. 
[6]Oh, the usual one.  "Must return immediately to Earth... the wife needs me..." 
[7]What are you here for?! 
[8]"Whoever you were"??? 
[9][And I thought...] 
[10]Memory erasure is what they use on agents.  Go away. 
[11]I'm not trusting you again. 
[12]That you was a liar.  Who you are now I don't even know. 
[13]Get out! 
[14]Get out!  Get the hell away from me! 
[15]Yes, Mr. Quail, I'm afraid it's all true. 
[16]I tried to break through to you earlier, but you just molded me into your fantasy. Sometimes it takes Dr. Edgemar to get through to a client as tough as you. 
[17]Please, Mr. Quail... try to cooperate.  You're having a schizophrenic embolism. 
[18]Watch out, Charles!  There's more of them in the hall! 
[19]There's an explosive in the clipboard!  He has a dead-man switch in his hand! 
[20]They kidnapped me.  Said they'd kill you if I didn't cooperate.  I told them I didn't care, but then when I realized they meant it... 
[21]We were together before. 
[22]Go, Bennie, for God's sake! 
[23]What? 
[24]You better have two aces, Bennie. There's a second cruiser -- and it's gaining -- 
[25]No.  But we still believe in a free Mars. 
[26]You - when you were Charles Hauser with E.I.O - infiltrated our group.  I guess Cohaagen didn't trust you any more when you and 
[27]...so he had your memory wiped and fixed you up with a new identity. 
[28]I don't know. 
[29]Maybe there's a way  you can get your memory back. 
[30]A bit of Martian Wisdom. We're not all stupid colonists. 
[31]He's doing it! 
[32]Clearing everyone out!  It's been rumored for months... 
[33]I though you believed in our cause? 
[34]Ssssh...there are skills on mars that Earth has forgotten. 
[35]This is for our cause! 
[36]That's interplanetary robbery! 
[37]Charles!  Are you all right? 
[38]He kept dragging you deeper and deeper into the trance! We couldn't wake either of you! 
[39]Are you okay?... Charles? Doug?  Whoever? 
[40]But why? 
[41]The Oracle... what did you learn? 
[42]What are we doing, Charles? For God's sake, tell us. 
[43]Purpose?  What purpose? 
[44]For what?  To do what? 
[45]So why is Cohaagen shipping everyone out? 
[46]And Cohaagen's going to own it all! 
[47]No wonder he wanted you to... penetrate... out group. 
[48]So what can we do? 
[49]But who'll work the machine? Do you know how? 
[50]But Cohaagen wiped your memory!!! 
[51]And all without the marvels of modern science! 
[52]You bastard. 
[53]But what about the Martian people?  Out cause?  I thought you believed in it. 
[54]We got in with this thing, but we'll never get back out. 
[55]Remind me not to slip. 
[56]Where'd you get that little trick? 
[57]Great stuff, but how do we get up? 
[58]Those shuttles are starting up any minute.  If you know how to work this thing, you better do it now. 
[59]Don't you know how? 
[60]Don't wait! 
[61]space shuttles on video screens 
[62]It's happening.
dialogues.BENNIE:
[1]Mine's right around the corner. 
[2]But I out-hustle him, right? 
[3]Sorta.  Bunch of miners out here got their own claims, from way back.  Cohaagen's buyin' em all up, says he's gonna cut off the air an' water if they won't sell... 
[4]You don't look so good, boss. All over the Universe, women is an awful curse. 
[5]It's a tough planet, boss. 
[6]Some guy really screwed her - screwed her up real good. Some Earthman.  Just hopped on a space shuttle. 
[7]If that means I know it all, you're right, boss. 
[8]I don't know nothin'.  Not about the Sphinx.  That's out of the ball park. 
[9]No can do, mon.  You want women, cigarettes, red-market money, booze, even air or water... Bennie's your man. But the Sphinx... that's 
[10]Well... look at that one, eh? 
[11]Big cheese in town.  Big smelly cheese. 
[12]No way.  That cat just cheat the Martian workers without ever leavin' his place in Beverly Hills.  Somethin' must be cookin'. 
[13]Bad news, boss lady. 
[14]Black cruiser just pull out behind us. 
[15]Forget the shooter, boss.  I lose 'em for you. 
[16]Hang on! 
[17]Yutani 650 -- you like it, boss?  Nothing like the old gas when you want a bit of speed. 
[18]Nothin', boss.  Just old smokies.  Only place they can come for a puff.  It's all banned topside. 
[19]That's right, boss. 
[20]Well, maybe we ain't fashion leaders, boss. 
[21]Just an ole heap o' stone, boss. 
[22]Aw, come off it, man.  Just for a bit of mumbo-jumbo with a crystal ball. 
[23]You stopped breathing! 
[24]No choice, boss.  It was him or you. 
[25]Phobos and Demos!  What was that all about? 
[26]Well... you go outta here... take a left, then down past the first... no second... water bureau you... 
[27]No problem. 
[28]Impossible, man.  Guards everywhere. 
[29]We'll never get near the Sphinx!  They'll blow us apart! 
[30]It's a hunk of old stone, man. 
[31]Just deliverin' some old junk to the mine out at Apidalia Planitia.  Got them people you're lookin' for in the back as well. 
[32]You sure the little man didn't fry your brain, Quail? 
[33]That's air! 
[34]Man!  This is real complicated. Go over it again, real slow. 
[35]Like I said.  It's a tough planet.  I'm a baddie, not a goodie. 
[36]EIO Rule One, man.  Trust Nobody.  Now you can do your terriforming stuff right when those space shuttles are gone. 
[37]Your cause?  That bunch of dead beat radicals!  When I hand in this little number... ...I'll get real estate rights on the whole of Chryse Planitia... 
[38]This makes Bennie a cut above anyone else.
dialogues.KIRSTEN:
[1]It's your time of the month again. 
[2]At least once a month.  Douglas Quail's obsession.  For twelve years you've been talking about Mars. 
[3]That's right, Douglas.  But not you.  Not us. 
[4]As it is, we can barely scrape by on your lousy ten thousand a week. 
[5]What do they expect ... the way men dress these days ... then they scream rape. 
[6]Rape men in the park? 
[7]Go to hell. 
[8]...more of a half-wit.  For a start a war could break out there any day ... 
[9]Well, there's a lot of things we need around here before we waste our money on a trip to Mars.  We're broke.  I'm just a slave around this dump. Now if you were capable of finding a better job.... 
[10]Yeah?  Who's going to report me?  You?... wimp.... 
[11]Screwing around's illegal, too.  But just give me half a chance... 
[12]What!  This stupid obsess... 
[13]Doug, you've got to forget... 
[14]Oh my God... 
[15]What men?  Doug, you're crazy. 
[16]You're here now.  They didn't kill you. 
[17]Where?  Where are they? 
[18]Doug!  It's something they put into your mind at the memory place.  Fantasies. That's their business. 
[19]You're a computer operator. You're a bore.  You're a wimp.  You're not a killer. 
[20]Doug, I want you to see a doctor.  Now Alec and Shirley Turnbull have a good man.  He helped Alec through his breakdown. 
[21]I haven't seen you move that fast since I've known you. 
[22]I'm not your wife, Quail. 
[23]nursing her arm 
[24]No, Quail.  It's true.  You work for E.I.O.  So do I. 
[25]We had to watchdog you...make sure the erasure took.  A wife seemed like a good idea. 
[26]All implanted. 
[27]The job's real -- you've had is six weeks -- since you got back from Mars. 
[28]It's all a fabrication, Quail. Everything you know. 
[29]You exist, all right. That's the problem. 
[30]They don't particularly.  That was my idea.  This assignment was boring me to death.  The personality they gave you wasn't too thrilling. 
[31]I've no idea.  I just work here. 
[32]I don't have to follow you. You can't get away from E.I.O. Nobody does.
dialogues.COHAAGEN:
[1]We're dealing with a bunch of extremists and unrepresentative lunatics.  Mars is a happy and prosperous protectorate of Earth... and will remain so. 
[2]I have no further comment. 
[3]Anything? 
[4]There must be something -- some place he would go, some friend he would run to. 
[5]Again?! 
[6]Are you sure the original suppression took? 
[7]Then how do you explain what he's doing? 
[8]He'll remember Mars?  The Sphinx Project? 
[9]What do you think I am?  A barbarian?  We're not living in the twentieth century! 
[10]Hold it there. 
[11]I take it, then, you've failed to get him again. 
[12]Proceed with Operation Sphinx. 
[13]With him... ...on the lose, I'm not taking any more chances. Operation Sphinx will flush him out. 
[14]The air supply is off under the domes? 
[15]Any trouble with the rabble? 
[16]How the hell did they get in? 
[17]Up the fusion core?? 
[18]Seal all upper levels. 
[19]Forget them.  We'll pick up Quail once the shuttles have left for Earth. 
[20]We'll tell him the computer's worked out the operational details so we don't really need him.  We're just doing him a favor. 
[21]We offer him rewards. 
[22]We'll torture him.  You don't think I got this far by being a nice guy? 
[23]Seal the breach!  Repressurize! 
[24]Wait! 
[25]If you activate the mechanism you'll die...there were glimpses of it in your memory. 
[26]That's your death.  That's what it looks like.  That's what is always looks like. 
[27]It's not too late.  Join us again.  U've a lot to offer. A whole world.
dialogues.LULL:
[1]It the Pope Martian? 
[2]Now, just relax, kid.  This ain't gonna hurt.  Just a controlled drip of Narkadine. When you're under, I'll just ask ya a few questions, nothin' real personal, just full details of yer private life so's we can tailor the wish-fulfillment program to your needs. 
[3]See?  Painless.  I didn't feel a thing.  Hey, you're a nice kid... you like a little somethin' extra? 
[4]Good!  Kid -- have I got a girl for you!  She's gonna like you.  You're good-lookin'. Gettin' sleepy? Good.  Now, what's the first thing you think of when you're thinkin' about Mars? 
[5]Okay -- you will, Dougle!  I want ya to start counting backwards from a hundred for me. 
[6]Okay, Ernie, the trip to Mars; number sixty-two... and throw in that blonde... We'll give him a real good time. 
[7]Dougie?  This Sophie Lull. Can ya hear me? 
[8]Good! ... I'm gonna ask ya a few more questions now.  Ya think you'll be able to answer 'em? 
[9]Attaboy!  To begin with, I wanna ask ya; -- You sex life.  How many orgasms a week? Yes? 
[10]Howie?  Listen, you'd better get in here. Not another schizoid embolism. 
[11]You'd better get in here. 
[12]Quail?  Dougie, can you hear me? 
[13]Tell McClane what you told us. 
[14]The Narkadine cracked a memory cap.  Mars -- He's really been there. Forced suppression? 
[15]He wants a false memory implanted -- of a trip he really took. Someone at Earth Intelligence Operations erased his memory. All he know was going to Mars meant something special to him. 
[16]Uh-uh... That could promote a partial breakthrough of the real trip. 
[17]Why don't we just wipe out the memory of his visit here? Yes.  Good.  I'll destroy his file and cancel his fee. I have a feeling that the longer he doesn't know who he is, where he's been, where he's going and who we are, the better off we'll all be.  I'm taking a holiday. A real one.
dialogues.EDGEMAR:
[1]Hello, Mr. Quail.  May I come in?  I won't be offended if you prefer to keep the gun you're holding trained on me. 
[2]My card, Mr. Quail. 
[3]As I said... this is going to be very difficult -- for both of us. 
[4]Mr. Quail... I'm afraid you're not really standing here at this moment. 
[5]I said, you're not really here.  Neither am I.  We're both in the Memory Studio -- in the offices of Rekall, Inc. On Earth. 
[6]No, not quite.  We didn't give you this.  You're creating it yourself -- Remember the option we offered you?  Intelligence agent? Something inside you liked that idea, fastened on it. What you're experiencing now is a free-form delusion that you yourself are fabricating. 
[7]This is not -- shit, Mr. Quail. It's the truth. I know it's very hard for you to accept, but you're having a schizophrenic reaction... we can't snap you out of the Narkadine.  You're in a world of your own fantasy. 
[8]I've been artificially implanted -- like the first part of your fantasy.  I'm actually monitoring your dream at a psychoprobe console. This is a last resort.  When somebody gets stuck in their own fantasy, we send in someone after them.  A specialist, like myself. 
[9]I was afraid you'd think that. I'm sorry to have to do this, but you really are stuck. Doctor Noel, would you come in now please? 
[10]Just do exactly as we tell you. 
[11]If we can't get you out now... you may never come out of it. Your wife calls every day -- 
[12]But there will by consequences inside your mind.  Consequences that won't hurt me... but could be fatal to you. If you shoot me, you'll wipe me out of your fantasy -- I can't come back again.  Because to you, I'll be dead.  I can't help you get back to reality. You'll be stuck in permanent psychosis. 
[13]You're going to lower the gun, Mr. Quail.  You're going to hand it to me -- 
[14]You're going to do exactly what I tell you --
dialogues.KUATO:
[1]No need to introduce yourself, Mr. Quail. Tolerate my presumption, but it does not tax my powers to know that you are the most sought-after man on two worlds. 
[2]This way, my dear man.  We have much to accomplish -- -- and very little time. 
[3]The turbulence you hear outside is but a reflection of the turmoil within you. You have brought it to Mars in your search for yourself. 
[4]Indubitably.  There is only small matter of a fee. 
[5]Income before ideals.  Shall we say five-hundred-thousand dollars? 
[6]Not Martian dollars, Mr. Quail - Earth dollars. 
[7]What price do you put, Mr. Quail, on the future of the solar system? 
[8]Listen, buster, we're talking heavy stuff here.  You try and work out what's with this guy! 
[9]Retrieving the past is like walking backwards along a perilous road.  The half-recalled, the half-forgotten, the repressed, the fantasies, the triumphs, joys, failures, betrayals... 
[10]Yes... I can feel it... a wall.  Erasure techniques are so brutal. Blocks.  Side channels. Future and past all jumbled. I shall have to enter deep trance to break through. I will be scanning you through the Oracle Head.
dialogues.TELEPHONE VOICE:
[1]If you want to live, don't hand up. 
[2]They've got you bugged... They're gonna find you. Faster than you can say "Back Rodgers". And don't bother shaking down your clothes -- the monitor is embedded in your skull. 
[3]Take a wet towel and wrap it around your head.  That will deaden the signal.  It'll take longer for them to pinpoint you. 
[4]There's a real old saying - "Beggars can't be choosers". Go and soak your head! 
[5]Head over to Skid Row -- to the Lucky Stub Pawnshop -- corner of Park Avenue and Fifty-eighth.  Tell the man you're Mr. Hotchkiss; you came for your Grecian candlesticks. 
[6]Just do it!  This is no time for small talk. 
[7]I've been tailing you since you get back from Mars. 
[8]I'm E.I.O.  But I was your best friend.  Scott Stevens - we arranged this... 
[9]I was your fail-safe -- if and when the shooting started. Good luck.  Look me up if you remember me.
dialogues.DRIVER:
[1]Travelling south along Third Avenue, passing Fourty-third street. 
[2]Thirty-three thirteen "G" Street, Sector "L", Twin Towers, Apartment six-thirty- five. 
[3]I don not understand the question, sir or madam. 
[4]You stepped into it in the normal manner, sir or madam. 
[5]Cut the language, will ya? 
[6]Toldya the Martian assembled [stuff don't work.] 
[7]Where?
dialogues.1ST AGENT:
[1]Aren't you the man from Mars? 
[2]You told everyone at Rekall about you trip to Mars. Where you went, who you worked for, what you did -- 
[3]You've remembered too much. The Sphinx Project, for a start.... 
[4]They've been taken care of. 
[5]Get in the car. 
[6]No one's going to kill you if [you do what you're told.] We're visiting E.I.O. for some new tests.  Now get in, or do we start playing rough? 
[7]What, Quail?  What do you remember?
dialogues.CLERK:
[1]Room...thirty-six. 
[2]He was only meeting a lady... Aren't you guys overdoing it a bit? 
[3]Nice to have you back with us, Mr. Hauser. 
[4]Part of my job, sir. 
[5]Charles.  Charles Hauser, right? 
[6]I'm sorry, sir.  But Earth government has sealed off the excavation site completely. No one but survey teams and archaeologists are allowed closer than twenty miles. 
[7]Oh... Do you want the item you left with us?
dialogues.VOICE:
[1]Mr. Hauser... 
[2]Mr. Hauser, I want to talk to you... about Douglas Quail. 
[3]My name is George Edgemar. I work for Rekall, Incorporated. 
[4]Yes.  It's difficult to explain... Could you open the door, please?  I'm not armed. 
[5]You've had it, Hauser!  Throw out your weapon if you want a past! 
[6]What do you say, Hauser?  We haven't got all night!  Hauser? 
[7]We'll put in a word with the big boys.  Maybe you'll just get exile to Venus.
dialogues.EMILE:
[1]But, sir... 
[2]Yes, sir.  In a couple of hours it'll be all gone. 
[3]Not much, sir.  A lot of complaining.  But they're all heading towards the shuttle areas. 
[4]If Quail's the only one who can operate all this... ...then he can call all the shots. 
[5]And if that doesn't work? 
[6]What if that doesn't work?
